New Records: Hardik Pandya scored his career-best 71* in the first T20I
India posted 208 for 6, their highest T20I total against Australia
Key Match Events: Hardik Pandya's 71* powered India to their highest T20I total vs Australia
Josh Hazlewood struck early to remove Rohit Sharma
Nathan Ellis prized out Virat Kohli for only 2
Post-Match Reflections: Hardik Pandya was delighted after finishing the Indian innings with a hat-trick of sixes and recording his career-best T20I score
Others: India started off well with both Rohit Sharma and KL Rahul playing some lusty blows
Rahul then struck his 18th T20I half-century while also becoming the fifth Indian batter to score 2000 runs in T20Is
Rahul then departed for a well-made 55 and Yadav couldn't stay in much longer as he fell short of his half-ton by four runs
India finished brilliantly and scored 60 runs in the last four overs thanks to the clean hitting from Pandya
Rahul told the broadcasters in the innings break that it took some time to get used to the bounce of the pitch and that he used his experience and worked on hitting on both sides of the ground
